content.question: Which of the following statements best describes the motivic transformation of the music in measures 9–11 when it returns in measures 25–27 ?

choices.label: The meter changes in the treble and bass clefs, resulting in rhythmic transformation and pitch embellishment in both the soprano and the bass.
The meter changes in the treble clef, resulting in rhythmic transformation and pitch embellishment in the soprano while the bass and overall harmony remain the same.
The meter changes in the treble clef, resulting in rhythmic transformation in the soprano; the bass is embellished with nonharmonic tones.
The meter changes in the treble clef, but the musical material in both the soprano and the bass is repeated unchanged.

content.answer: The meter changes in the treble clef, resulting in rhythmic transformation and pitch embellishment in the soprano while the bass and overall harmony remain the same.
